channel.title: Php include problems
channel.description:
Alright, lets say I want to load all the text in index.php from a different file "txt.php" But for some reason it's just not working?
index.php: [code] <!DOCTYPE html> <?php include'txt.php';?> <html lang="en"> <head> <link href='http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Noto+Sans' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'> <script src="http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.8.0.min.js"></script> <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/style.css"> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=UTF-8"> <title><? echo '$title';?></title> [/code]
text.php: [code] <?php $title = echo 'NickBraks - Web Developer'; ?> [/code]
thanks!

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

nickb:

thanks for the help! the problem was the ’ ’ in the title!

What you were doing is called string interpolation and in PHP that only works in double-quotes as Pure_ pointed out.

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

nickb:

thanks for the help! the problem was the ’ ’ in the title!

[quote=“Pure_, post:5, topic:539992”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=658842.msg4406733#msg4406733 date=1392223973]

inclue 'file_name.php'; is fine
[/quote]I’m going to say it isn’t?

OP when using print with single-quotes the value of the variable isn’t printed, try doing print “$var_name”, close enough though.[/quote]

…

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:8, topic:539992”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658842.msg4406744#msg4406744 date=1392225427]

I have never heard about “import(…)” in PHP, and I can’t find anything about it in the documentation either… are you sure you’re not thinking of CSS?

PHP: include
[/quote]The confusion is real, I meant include of course.

Ah, okay. What’s the difference between include(…) and include ‘…’? I can’t see any different mentioned in the PHP manual, but both styles are shown.[/quote]No difference, you didn’t mention it explicitly so I decided i would, I said the prior since typing import’…’ looks retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:7, topic:539992”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=658842.msg4406743#msg4406743 date=1392225266]
I have never heard about “import(…)” in PHP, and I can’t find anything about it in the documentation either… are you sure you’re not thinking of CSS?

PHP: include
[/quote]The confusion is real, I meant include of course.[/quote]

Ah, okay. What’s the difference between include(…) and include ‘…’? I can’t see any different mentioned in the PHP manual, but both styles are shown.

Read full topic

I have never heard about “import(…)” in PHP, and I can’t find anything about it in the documentation either… are you sure you’re not thinking of CSS?

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:4, topic:539992”]inclue 'file_name.php'; is fine[/quote]I’m going to say it isn’t?

OP when using print with single-quotes the value of the variable isn’t printed, try doing print “$var_name”, close enough though.

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:2, topic:539992”]Try this in text.php:

<?php $title = "NickBraks - Web Developer"; ?>

And change this in index.php:

(Remove the ’ ’ around $title)

Also, you’re including “txt.php” not “text.php”.[/quote]He will still need to ‘import’ it. Syntax being include(‘file_name.php’).

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Try this in text.php:

<?php $title = "NickBraks - Web Developer"; ?>

And change this in index.php:

(Remove the ’ ’ around $title)

Also, you’re including “txt.php” not “text.php”.

Read full topic

item.title: Php include problems
item.dc:creator: @nickb nickb
item.description:
@nickb wrote:

Alright, lets say I want to load all the text in index.php from a different file "txt.php"
But for some reason it’s just not working?

index.php:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<?php include'txt.php';?>
<html lang="en">
<head>
	<link href='http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Noto+Sans' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>
	<script src="http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.8.0.min.js"></script>
	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="css/style.css">
	<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=UTF-8">
	<title><? echo '$title';?></title>

text.php:

<?php
$title = echo 'NickBraks - Web Developer';
?>

thanks!

Read full topic
